description: Fannie Mae Form 1004 Uniform Residential Appraisal Report Review Checklist

items.criterion: Property address and legal description are complete and accurate
items.description: Verify that the property address, including street, city, state, and ZIP code, is complete and matches the legal description
items.guidelines: The property must be clearly identified with no ambiguity. Address must match title documents and legal records.

items.criterion: Appraiser is properly licensed and certified
items.description: Confirm that the appraiser holds a valid license in the state where the property is located
items.guidelines: Appraiser must have valid state certification or license. License number must be provided and verifiable.

items.criterion: Appraisal effective date is recent and appropriate
items.description: The effective date of the appraisal should be recent (typically within 120 days)
items.guidelines: Most lenders require appraisals completed within 120 days of loan closing. Older appraisals may require updates.

items.criterion: Three to six comparable sales are included and appropriate
items.description: Verify that 3-6 comparable sales are provided, are recent (within 12 months), and are similar to subject property
items.guidelines: Comparables should be similar in size, age, condition, and location. Sales should be arms-length transactions within the past 12 months.

items.criterion: Adjustments to comparable sales are reasonable and explained
items.description: All adjustments to comparable sales must be documented and fall within acceptable ranges
items.guidelines: Adjustments should typically not exceed 10% per line item or 15% total net adjustment. All adjustments must be explained.

items.description: The appraisal must include detailed description of property condition, including any defects or needed repairs
items.guidelines: Appraiser must note overall condition (excellent, good, average, fair, poor) and identify any health/safety issues.

items.criterion: Square footage is accurately measured and documented
items.description: Living area square footage must be calculated according to ANSI standards
items.guidelines: Measurements should follow ANSI Z765 standards. Gross Living Area (GLA) must be clearly distinguished from total area.

items.criterion: Current market conditions are analyzed and discussed
items.description: Appraisal should include analysis of current market trends, supply/demand, and appreciation/depreciation
items.guidelines: Include discussion of days on market, price trends, inventory levels, and market forecasts for the area.

items.criterion: Highest and best use is appropriately determined
items.description: The appraisal must conclude that the current use represents the highest and best use of the property
items.guidelines: Highest and best use analysis considers legal permissibility, physical possibility, financial feasibility, and maximum productivity.

items.criterion: Final value reconciliation is logical and supported
items.description: The final opinion of value must be reconciled and explained based on the approaches used
items.guidelines: Appraiser must explain the logic and reasoning for the final value conclusion, including weight given to each approach to value.
